death.attack.sync.fingerstick: %s died in the name of science
command.sync.ghostshells.invalid_action: Available actions are: sync, remove and repair
command.sync.ghostshells.not_found: %s has no information about the shell that should be located at %s

command.sync.ghostshells.removed: Successfully removed shell (%2$s) from %1$s's radial menu

event.sync.construction.fail.health: You don't have enough health to perform this operation
event.sync.construction.fail.occupied: This shell container is already occupied
event.sync.any.fail.undead: This operation cannot be performed by an undead player

gui.sync.shell_selector.down.title: Next world

text.autoconfig.sync.title: Sync (Fabric)
text.autoconfig.sync.option.enableInstan: If this option is enabled, creative-like shells will be
constructed immediately, without the use of energy
text.autoconfig.sync.option.warnPlayerIn: Warn players instead of killing them
If this option is enabled, a player won't be killed by a shell
constructor if they don't have enough health to create a new shell
text.autoconfig.sync.option.fingerstickD: The amount of damage that a shell constructor will deal
to a player when they try to create a new shell
text.autoconfig.sync.option.hardcoreFing: The amount of damage that a shell constructor will deal to a player
in the Hardcore mode when they try to create a new shell
text.autoconfig.sync.option.shellStorage: Energy consumption of a shell storage's
Accept redstone as a power source
If this option is enabled, a shell
storage can be powered by redstone
Determines how many ticks a shell can survive without
a power supply connected to the corresponding shell storage
text.autoconfig.sync.option.energyMap: The amount of energy a treadmill can produce per tick
text.autoconfig.sync.option.energyMap.@T: Specifies a list of entities that can
text.autoconfig.sync.option.EnergyMapEnt: The amount of energy an entity can produce per tick
The amount of energy produced per tick
text.autoconfig.sync.option.preserveOrig: If this option is enabled, all user shells will share the same origins
text.autoconfig.sync.option.syncPriority: The order of shell selection for synchronization
text.autoconfig.sync.option.wrench.@Tool: Identifier of an item that can be used as a wrench
in order to change a shell constructor's state
text.autoconfig.sync.option.updateTransl: If this option is enabled, translations will be
updated every time the game is launched
